about.title: Project
copy: On June 28, 1969 police raided the Stonewall Inn, one of the few establishments that at the time welcomed people from the gay community. Brave individuals rose up to demand LGBTQ equality and the so called Stonewall Riots that followed and lasted for 5 nights, became the beginning of the modern LGBTQ rights movement. To honor the Stonewall Riot’s 50th anniversary and share the many stories that have gone untold, Stink Studios partnered with the LGBT Community Center, with support from Google.org, to create Stonewall Forever.

Stonewall Forever aims to find, preserve and share the untold stories and historical materials from the early years of the LGBTQ rights movement. Through the online form people, that have been a part of this historic period, are encouraged to add any historical material or personal stories to a growing collection which will be available online and at the LGBT Community Center’s National History Archive in New York.
This is a static PWA built in Gatsby.js v1, using React.js, Post CSS + CSS modules and GraphQL.

about.title: Project
copy: Since I got diagnosed with celiac disease a few years ago I’ve often been struggling to find meat- and gluten free recipes that are nice and inspiring (and not as in just ‘GF pasta pesto’ or a lame salad).

To solve this I created 2cool4gluten.com, a veggie gluten free recipe generator and inspo tool for people on a GF diet, and all their friends who love throwing dinner parties. By clicking the button the app will generate a randomized link to a gluten free and vegetarian recipe.
The app is built with React.js and Sass and uses Babel + Webpack for compiling.

about.title: Project
copy: Chobani, the leading yoghurt brand in US, partnered with Stink Studios to create their new dot com as part of their big rebranding launching in beginning of 2018. To respond to the client’s request for great functionality and flexibility we built a site with page templates where the client can customize the page layouts, using over 10 flexible React modules that include frame and positioning options to name a few. It’s using the headless CMS Contentful which operates separately from the front-end and allows teams to define their own data structure to fit their needs.

To respond to Chobani’s huge audience we also implemented various accessibility improvements such as a contrast color check on the hex values coming from the CMS data, to guarantee a good readability throughout the site.
The stack includes: React.js, Redux, Immutable.js, Post CSS + CSS modules as well as Babel and Webpack for compiling.
Read more about how we built the site here.

about.title: Project
copy: Together with three friends from Hyper Island I created a campaign for Sweden’s Ministry of Foregin Affairs’ initiative called Midwives4all. The brief was to raise awareness of the problems of maternal and newborn death in low income countries, by mainly focusing on emphasizing the benefits of midwifery, and the important role midwives have when it comes to ensure a safe pregnancy and motherhood for all women. The long term goal is for maternal and newborn health to be a prioritized topic in every country and government.

We created an informative yet emotional video to highlight the problem and potential solution. To reach out to as many social media users as possible we used Thunderclap, which is a powerful crowd speaking tool. In addition to this we built a dropdown Twitter recruit where a specific country is targeted and a list of influential Twitter users popular in that country can be shuffled and encouraged to join the cause through Thunderclap. The campaign successfully reached a big crowd and #midwives4all reached trending topic on Twitter by the end of the campaign.
My role in this project included campaign concept and strategy, as well as video manuscript and site copy. I was also one out of two developers who built the site.

about.title: Project
copy: Google Cloud wanted a simple and interactive way of illustrating the core differences between their Standard and Premium Network tiers and teamed up with Stink Studios. The request was to mainly highlight the performance and extensive availability of the Premium Network tier.

As one of the front-end developers on this project my responsibility was to build the site layout and all the UI. To fit a lot of information in one page and still keep the site relatively spacious we used overlays, popups and tooltips across the site.
This is a Firebase app built with Javascript ES6, Stylus and Three.js for the interactive 3D globe.
